City Manager's Office
=====================

In accordance with the Lakeway City Charter, the City of Lakeway operates as a council-manager form of government. The mayor and six councilmembers are elected officials and serve as the legislative body of the city.Â   
  
The city manager is responsible for the proper administration of all City affairs. The city manager and [assistant city manager](https://www.lakeway-tx.gov/1806/Assistant-City-Manager) work closely with the City Council and the department directors to provide the highest level of service for the residents and businesses of Lakeway.

Joseph Molis
------------

**City Manager for the City of Lakeway, Texas**  
**November 2022 - Present**

![Joseph](https://www.lakeway-tx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=42875)

Joseph Molis serves as the City Manager for the City of Lakeway, officially appointed by a unanimous City Council vote on November 21, 2022. He originally joined the City of Lakeway in late 2020 as Assistant City Manager and was appointed Interim City Manager in September 2022. After a competitive selection process, he was chosen as City Manager, earning the confidence of the City Council and community leadership.

Before his tenure in Lakeway, Joseph spent over a decade with the City of Harker Heights, where he advanced to Director of Planning and Development in 2015. His experience in urban and strategic planning, economic development, and commercial and residential development has provided him with a strong foundation in city management. He is also a certified Geographic Information Systems Professional (GISP) and serves on the Texas State University Public Administration Advisory Council.

As City Manager, Joseph is focused on understanding Lakewayâ€™s community, aligning priorities with the Cityâ€™s Comprehensive Plan, and building key relationships to support the Cityâ€™s mission: To enhance the quality of life for our family of citizens within our available means by providing and facilitating safe, quality services, programs, and facilities while preserving our history and protecting our natural resources.

Raised in the Austin area, Joseph earned his B.S. in Geography and Geographic Information Systems from Texas State University, followed by a Masterâ€™s Degree in Public Administration from the same institution in 2019. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his wife and daughter, reading, and indulging his passion for Star Trek and Star Wars.
